metadata.title: CVE-2020-36788 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:drm/nouveau: avoid a use-after-free when BO init fails nouveau_bo_init() isbacked by ttm_bo_init() and ferries its return code back to the caller. Onfailures, ttm_bo_init() invokes the provided destructor which shouldde-initialize and free the memory. Thus, when nouveau_bo_init() returns anerror the gem object has already been released and the memory freed bynouveau_bo_del_ttm().

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
linux-aws package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
linux-azure package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
